articles.headline: Fed Trims Rates Sharply, Sending the Markets Up
articles.snippet: The cut was smaller than investors had expected and exposed some signs of a split among policy makers.
articles.abstract: The cut was smaller than investors had expected and exposed some signs of a split among policy makers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve reduced short-term interest rates for the sixth time in six months on Tuesday, capping an extraordinary series of measures it has taken to stabilize financial markets. The cut was smaller than investors had been expecting, though, and exposed some signs of a split among policy makers.

articles.headline: It’s Bondholders vs. Shareholders in a Race to Buy Bear Stearns Stock
articles.snippet: A battle seems to be brewing in the markets over the fate of the troubled investment bank. Bondholders like the JPMorgan deal, but Bear’s shareholders hope to scuttle it.
articles.abstract: A battle seems to be brewing in the markets over the fate of the troubled investment bank. Bondholders like the JPMorgan deal, but Bear’s shareholders hope to scuttle it.
articles.lead_paragraph: Only days after the fire sale of Bear Stearns stunned Wall Street, a battle seems to be brewing in the markets over the fate of the troubled investment bank and the controversial deal that JPMorgan and federal authorities devised to save it.

articles.headline: Can’t Grasp Credit Crisis? Join the Club
articles.snippet: This may not be comforting, but your confusion is shared by many people in the middle of this financial crisis.
articles.abstract: This may not be comforting, but your confusion is shared by many people in the middle of this financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: Raise your hand if you don’t quite understand this whole financial crisis.

articles.headline: Obama Urges U.S. to Grapple With Race Issue
articles.snippet: Barack Obama confronted the divisions between black and white as he sought to dispel the furor over his pastor’s words.
articles.abstract: Barack Obama confronted the divisions between black and white as he sought to dispel the furor over his pastor’s words.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA  Senator Barack Obama delivered a sweeping assessment of race in America on Tuesday, bluntly confronting the divisions between black and white as he sought to dispel the furor over inflammatory statements by his former pastor.

articles.headline: Dollar’s Fall Is No Cause for Alarm in Euro Zone
articles.snippet: A surging euro is indisputably a burden for Europe’s exporters, but it has not yet had a sharp effect on European economies.
articles.abstract: A surging euro is indisputably a burden for Europe’s exporters, but it has not yet had a sharp effect on European economies.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT  When the euro tiptoed above $1.30 four years ago, finance ministers from Germany, France and Austria wrung their hands about how it would hurt Europe’s exporters, some muttering that the United States should put its economic house in order.

articles.headline: An Export in Solid Supply
articles.snippet: A reorganization of the global coal trade is making the United States a major exporter for the first time in years, and driving up prices of the one fossil fuel the nation has in abundance.
articles.abstract: A reorganization of the global coal trade is making the United States a major exporter for the first time in years, and driving up prices of the one fossil fuel the nation has in abundance.
articles.lead_paragraph: These days, people really are taking coals to Newcastle.

articles.headline: Swinging Between Optimism and Dread on Wall Street
articles.snippet: Despite reporting steep declines in first-quarter earnings, both Goldman Sachs and Lehman Brothers beat analysts’ expectations.
articles.abstract: Despite reporting steep declines in first-quarter earnings, both Goldman Sachs and Lehman Brothers beat analysts’ expectations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs and Lehman Brothers said Tuesday that their profits plunged  and all of Wall Street cheered.
